summary: The Seventh-day Adventist Church is a Christian group that believes in keeping Saturday as the Sabbath and in Jesus' soon return. It started in the 1800s in the United States and was founded by Ellen G. White and others. Adventists believe in the Bible's teachings, including the Trinity, and follow a healthy lifestyle, eating kosher food and being vegetarians. They think people's bodies, souls, and spirits are connected. The church has over 22 million members worldwide and runs schools, hospitals, and aid organizations. It is one of the fastest-growing churches globally.
title: Seventh-day Adventist Church
